messages.message:
I'm running into issues on my sandbox where a number of services are no longer able to start. I set it up for the first time yesterday and it seemed to work fine, but now a number of services are no longer able to start.

The main change I made was installing oh my zsh on the sandbox directly.

Sandbox url: https://instabase.sandboxes.site/sandboxes/ptenkale
I'm trying to revert it by uninstalling oh my zsh and changing the default shell back to /bin/bash with `chsh` , but I'm stuck here. What do I put in for `Password` on the sandbox environment?

This is the error message (most likely due to changing default shell to zsh)

```make -s list-deps >> /home/owner/instabase/webserver/api-server/build/pydeps.txt
make[1]: python: No such file or directory
make[1]: *** [/home/owner/instabase/webserver/api-server/../../shared-utils/build-utils/shared/build-python.mk:85: list-deps] Error 127
make: *** [/home/owner/instabase/webserver/api-server/../../shared-utils/build-utils/shared/build-python.mk:113: copy-py-deps] Error 2
make: Leaving directory '/home/owner/instabase/webserver/api-server'```

Hey! I think this is similar to the issue I had above:
https://instabase.slack.com/archives/C05L87V014J/p1736903131706169
I couldn't figure out what's wrong but I had a hacky solution at the end of the thread
If you don't want to use zsh, you can set the default shell back to bash with `sudo usermod -s $(which bash) owner` and then start a new terminal session
